**Discharge Summary Letter**

Dear ___,

We are pleased to inform you that you have been discharged from ___ Hospital following your recent admission. You were admitted on February 10, 2024, for treatment of lobar pneumonia, an infection for which you displayed symptoms such as cough, shortness of breath, hemoptysis, and fever. Upon admission, a Chest X-Ray revealed consolidation in the left lower lobe of your lung, and lab results indicated elevated inflammatory markers with a CRP of 60 mg/L and a WBC count of 12 x10^9/L.

During your hospital stay, you were under the care of Dr. ___, and an empirical antibiotic therapy was initiated promptly with Amoxicillin administered intravenously. Alongside, Paracetamol was used as needed to manage your fever. Over the course of your treatment, CRP and WBC counts trended downwards consistently, with CRP reducing to 20 mg/L and WBC count to 7 x10^9/L by February 13, 2024. Your vital signs, including temperature and oxygen saturation, showed improvement within the first few days of treatment.

Your response to the medication regimen was favorable, leading to improvements in all monitored parameters. By February 12, 2024, your temperature had normalized, and oxygen saturation was stable at 98%. Consequently, you were transitioned from intravenous to oral antibiotic therapy. Throughout your treatment, you were also prescribed Atorvastatin to manage your underlying condition.

As of February 14, 2024, your medical team considered you medically fit for discharge. You are to continue with oral Amoxicillin for the next five days to ensure complete resolution of the infection. Your follow-up appointment is scheduled at the outpatient clinic in two weeks to monitor your recovery and address any concerns that may arise.

Please ensure you adhere to the medication guidelines provided and remain vigilant for any symptoms such as persistent fever, difficulty breathing, or chest pain, reporting them immediately if they occur.

We wish you a full and swift recovery. If you have any questions or require further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact our office.

Yours sincerely,

___  
Discharge Coordinator  
___ Hospital
